name: Congenital Chylothorax with Refractory Hypoproteinemia
chief_complaint: Baby has difficulty breathing and appears swollen
prognosis: Guarded; depends on response to therapy and underlying etiology. High risk of complications like sepsis or chronic lung disease.
description: A rare condition where lymphatic fluid accumulates in the pleural space due to malformation or trauma to the thoracic duct. The resulting protein loss leads to severe hypoproteinemia, complicating management. Often idiopathic but may be associated with genetic syndromes like Noonan or Down syndrome.
